snippet: The car business's unpredictable fortunes have led some Detroiters to imagine a future for their city in which other forms of creativity, and industry, can flourish.
abstract: The car business's unpredictable fortunes have led some Detroiters to imagine a future for their city in which other forms of creativity, and industry, can flourish.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT -- Navigating tables laden with lentil burgers and smoked wild salmon B.L.T.'s, Sharon Robinson escorted a guest toward paintings hanging on the high walls of the Cass Cafe, a venerable gathering place near Wayne State University popular with students, poets and visual artists. The cafe is about three miles from Cobo Center, the site of the North American International Auto Show, where press previews officially begin on Monday.

headline.main: Little Engines of Creativity, Spinning Freely in the Motor City
